caption_original:
The Canadian Transportation Agency's story began 113 years ago.

Its first incarnation – the Board of Railway Commissioners – was established on a snowy day in February 1904 in Ottawa.

As Canada has evolved, our responsibilities and services evolved with it. 

Want to know more? Read At the Heart of Transportation: A Moving History >  http://ow.ly/IsZ530dbqS1
caption_cleaned: The Canadian Transportation Agency's story began years ago. Its first incarnation – the Board of Railway Commissioners – was established on a snowy day in February in Ottawa. As Canada has evolved, our responsibilities and services evolved with it. Want to know more? Read At the Heart of Transportation: A Moving History > 1

caption_original:
Our role is to determine if a suitable Canadian ship is available to perform the activity for which a coasting trade licence is being requested.

The applicant's role is to provide a clear and complete justification as to why a foreign ship must be imported to perform the proposed activity (if that's the case). 

The type of information required in this justification depends on the activity proposed.

More information is available in section 2.3 of our Guidelines at http://ow.ly/hRdD30aDDqn.
caption_cleaned: Our role is to determine if a suitable Canadian ship is available to perform the activity for which a coasting trade licence is being requested. The applicant's role is to provide a clear and complete justification as to why a foreign ship must be imported to perform the proposed activity (if that's the case). The type of information required in this justification depends on the activity proposed. More information is available in section of our Guidelines at .

caption_original:
"Travel on a plane, train, bus, or ferry is not just a convenience – it's an essential part of modern life.  We should move as close as possible to universal accessibility, with individual accommodation as the failsafe, not the default.  We should design for accessibility, build for accessibility, and train staff for accessibility. One in seven Canadians has a disability and this proportion is rising as the population ages, so this is both an ethical and a business imperative."

Scott Streiner speaks to the Accessibility Advisory Council on making Canada's national transportation system the most accessible in the world - from principles to practice. #a11y 

http://ow.ly/8HZG30cEWi0

caption_original:
National AccessAbility Week continues! 

Making sure that Canadians with disabilities enjoy a travel experience free of undue obstacles is our business. 

Our website has information on all aspects of accessible transportation: mobility aids, service animals, allergies, and more. Check us out at: http://ow.ly/ok5H30bOaeJ

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Be Sure to Have All of Your Travel Documents

It's your responsibility to have the proper travel documents to enter a foreign country and return to Canada. All Canadian travellers, including children, must have their own passport. Consult the diplomatic mission of each country you intend to visit for its entry requirements.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Be Sure to Have All of Your Travel Documents It's your responsibility to have the proper travel documents to enter a foreign country and return to Canada. All Canadian travellers, including children, must have their own passport. Consult the diplomatic mission of each country you intend to visit for its entry requirements. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Pack Smart

Include your contact information and your destination contact information inside each piece of baggage. Always carry essential and valuable items with you on board: your passport, identification and return tickets; medicines and medical devices; money, jewelry and electronic equipment; and, essential overnight items.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Pack Smart Include your contact information and your destination contact information inside each piece of baggage. Always carry essential and valuable items with you on board: your passport, identification and return tickets; medicines and medical devices; money, jewelry and electronic equipment; and, essential overnight items. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
When a coasting trade licence application is needed to transport passengers, we must determine if a Canadian-registered ship can provide an identical or similar adequate marine service.

To do this, we need complete, clear and pertinent information concerning the offered ship and the nature of the proposed activity.

To find out what kind of information you must provide in passenger service applications, see section 2.3 of our Guidelines at http://ow.ly/hRdD30aDDqn

To do this, we need complete, clear and pertinent information concerning the offered ship and the nature of the proposed activity. To find out what kind of information you must provide in passenger service applications, see section of our Guidelines at

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Don't Miss Your Flight

When available, pre-select your seat in advance of departure. Confirm your return flight at least 72 hours in advance. Monitor your points of contact for carrier notifications of departure time changes and cancellations. Check your flight's status at least 24 hours before departure and leaving for the airport.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
caption_cleaned: > Don't Miss Your Flight When available, pre-select your seat in advance of departure. Confirm your return flight at least hours in advance. Monitor your points of contact for carrier notifications of departure time changes and cancellations. Check your flight's status at least hours before departure and leaving for the airport. > Top Tips >

caption_original:
#TravelTips > Have Insurance When You Travel

Include protection against baggage loss, delay, damage or theft, trip cancellation or interruption, personal injury or death, as well as sufficient medical coverage.

 #FlySmart > Top 10 Tips > http://ow.ly/uy2l3061cit
